page.title: 19BATTLE OF NECHTANSMERE 685AD
page.content: LETHAM has been in the news recently on television and in the newspapers.The reason for all the publicity is the 1300th anniversary of the battle of Nechtansmere or Dun Nechtain (Dunnichen) which was fought on the 20th May.The Picts defeated the invading Northumbrian army at a site between Letham and Dunnichen. On Saturday,I8th May, Professor Geoffrey Barrow of Edinburgh University lectured a crowded village hall on the battle. A cairn,marking the site, commissioned by the Community Council, was unveiled by Professor Leslie Alcock,of Glasgow University, President of the Scottish Society of Antiquaries.Mr Graeme Cruickshank, historian, gave a short lecture at the battle site.
